thread.title: Evacuations ordered as concrete slab threatens to fall from San Francisco construction site
thread.title_full: Evacuations ordered as concrete slab threatens to fall from San Francisco construction site

title: Evacuations ordered as concrete slab threatens to fall from San Francisco construction site

organizations.name: tehama st.  san francisco fire department pio

text:
Evacuations ordered as concrete slab threatens to fall from San Francisco construction site 
By KTVU FOX 2 Facebook 0 Twitter 0 livefyre Email Print 
(KTVU) 
Fire officials are evacuating five buildings this afternoon in San Francisco's South of Market neighborhood where a 30,000-pound concrete slab is at risk of falling from the 30th floor of a building under construction. 
The slab is on the 30th floor of a construction site at 41 Tehama St., fire officials said on Twitter at 2:54 p.m. 
Fire officials are now evacuating that site and four nearby sites including 543 Howard St. and 44, 56 and 58 Tehama St. 
San Francisco Fire Department PIO Jonathan Baxter updated the situation at 4:00 p.m. and said the unoccupied building suffered a wall failure on the top floor as the wall was being constructed. Related stories... Building under construction collapses in India, killing 5 
He added that a crane attached to the top of the roof is cantilevered on the compromised wall. 
Construction workers have been evacuated. Fire officials said there are no injuries to civilians or fire department staff. 
Officials are awaiting information from structural engineers on how to remedy the situation safely.
